As a brand, we know there are far more important things in the world than just men's necklaces.

Our hearts hurt for the people of Ukraine. We are saddened by the events of the past 24 hours and as they continue to unfold.

Everyday citizens just like you and me are being displaced, living in fear, and unjustifiably hurt by their neighbors.

While most of our team sits a continent away, we find it important to help from afar however we can.

We don't wish to gain whatsoever from the situation with a % of sales being donated, or something similar, so we wanted to share the link to a credible charity that could certainly use some donations at this time called GlobalGiving.

GlobalGiving is one of the top-rated charities on Charity Navigator which means that a 3rd party has verified a large % of donations truly make it out to the field and efforts. That means optimal impact.

Right now they have a project called the Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund that is raising money. Here is a blurb of what your donations will be used for from their site:

"All donations to the Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund will support humanitarian assistance in impacted communities in Ukraine and surrounding regions where Ukrainian refugees have fled. GlobalGiving's local partners in Ukraine are bringing relief to displaced families and people in high-risk areas, and they need resources to continue and expand their vital work."

If you find yourself in a position to help, please use this link (also in our bio for the few couple days) to donate:
https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund/

Thanks fam! Our thoughts and prayers are with our friends in Ukraine. üá∫üá¶

STAND WITH UKRAINE üá∫üá¶ show your support for Ukraine with these earrings, available on the website now- 100% of profits will be donated to the Global Giving Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund on https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund/#menu 

From their website: ‚ÄúYour donation to this fund will support Ukrainians in need, with a focus on the most vulnerable, including children.‚Äù

GlobalGiving earned Charity Navigator‚Äôs highest rating of four stars in the latest ratings published by the charity evaluator. The Better Business Bureau‚Äôs review states that GlobalGiving meets all of its charity accreditation standards.

If you‚Äôre not able to donate at this time please share! Let‚Äôs all support Ukraine in any way we can, every donation helps.  Sending love and positive thoughts to everyone in Ukraine standing up so bravely for their country üíôüíõ #standwithukraine

The awful events happening in Ukraine hurts our hearts so deeply. Sending love and support to our team, colleagues and everyone currently in Ukraine or fleeing üá∫üá¶
As a business we‚Äôll be supporting organisations working to help those in need and encourage everyone who can to do the same. Some useful links below:

https://www.withukraine.org/
https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund/
https://donate.redcross.org.uk/appeal/ukraine-crisis-appeal
http://unicef.org/ukraine/en/donate-now
https://www.facebook.com/donate/507886070680475

We‚Äôll continue to post about skincare as we normally do but know that our thoughts are with everyone üíôüíõ

It‚Äôs time to stop the war!
 
If you are looking to help and support people in Ukraine here are a few useful sites to get you started. 
 
Razom for Ukraine - Razom, which means ‚Äútogether‚Äù in Ukrainian, is a volunteer charity organization that was founded in 2014 to support Ukrainians after Russia annexed Crimea.
https://razomforukraine.org
 
 
United Help Ukraine - The D.C.-based nonprofit is collecting donations to provide life-saving first aid kits and other emergency medical supplies to the front lines in war areas
https://www.facebook.com/donate/337101825010055/
 
GlobalGiving Ukraine Relief Fund - GlobalGiving is using all donations to support humanitarian assistance to impacted communities in Ukraine, as well as the surrounding regions where refugees have fled. Donating to the cause will provide basic necessities such as shelter, food, clean water, including health, psychosocial support, access to education and economic assistance and more.
https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund/
 
#StopTheWar #NoWars #SupportUkraine #Ukraine #Help #Ukrainecrisis #UkarineRussiaWar #Peace

The ongoing crisis in Ukraine under Russian onslaught has forced many citizens to flee their homes, leaving most of their belongings behind. In such situations, women and girls are at heightened risk of sexual and gender based violence.

Pramila Patten, UN Special Representative on Sexual Violence in Conflict said in a statement that ‚ÄúUnless the conflict ceases, thousands of additional families will be forcibly displaced, dramatically escalating the scale of the already dire humanitarian situation, and increasing the risk of sexual violence and exploitation."

The statement further called on these factors to be taken into consideration when early warning signs of impact are observed so that an appropriate and proportionate response can be formulated well in time. UN Women also called on women's full and meaningful participation as vital in improving peace and security processes. In this regard, they recognized the civil society organizations on the ground who are critical partners in the work to amplify the voices of women and girls. The inclusion of women themselves in the decision-making processes and humanitarian response is therefore essential to ensure that their rights are upheld.

You can help the women and girls in Ukraine in the following ways:

- Amplify their voices online and offline.
- Share verified sources for help and aid.
- Donate to protect through the UN Women Donation: https://donate.unwomen.org/en/ukraine
- Donate to UNICEF‚Äôs work with children in Ukraine: https://help.unicef.org/ukraine-emergency
- Donate to Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund by Global Giving: https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund/
- Donate through The International Committee of the Red Cross to improve living conditions for displaced people in Ukraine: https://www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine

Let's do all we can towards the relief work being done in Ukraine, to minimize atrocities against citizens, especially women and young girls.

#teamsayfty #ukrainecrisis #ukrainedonations #ukrainerussiacrisis

Sunflowers represent happiness, optimism, honesty, longevity, peace, and devotion. The sunflower possibly surpasses all other flowers in terms of its universal power to bring joy to people. If you've ever seen a field of sunflowers growing you know how incredibly joyful it can feel to be filled by their powerful presence and beauty.

The sunflower is also the national flower of Ukraine. In wishing peace and protection for the people of Ukraine, and wanting to help, I've decided to offer this pin as a fundraiser for the month of March. 50% of all proceeds from the purchase of one of these pins will go to Global Giving Org. They believe that organizations that are deeply rooted in local communities are in the best position to provide long-term support for survivors of conflicts like these, and I agree. By funding the relief efforts of local organizations, donations to this fund have the potential to build stronger response capacity so that these organizations are better equipped to face future challenges. You can learn more about what they do or simply donate directly here:

https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund/projects/#menu

Available now in my shop, link in my bio üíôüíõüåªüá∫üá¶üåªüíõüíô

An end to oppression and war. Freedom and equality for all. A little peace under the sun.

75 tracks of peace ‚Äì most of them unreleased rarities ‚Äì spanning a variety of genres, from dreampunk to ambient, synthwave to slushwave, and anything inbetween. There's something for everyone.

All profits from this charity compilation go to a help organization supporting the people of Ukraine [ globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund ] . The price is set to 1 US dollar, but we absolutely encourage you to give more than that!

Thanks to all participating artists without whose generous contributions this would not have been possible. Thanks also to the labels involved in bringing it all together. Thank you for demonstrating that this community does NOT remain silent in the face of war.

At not least of all, thanks to all the brave people protesting the unjust actions taking place in Ukraine.

Here‚Äôs how our company is going to help our Ukrainian community of learners and teachers.
1. During March, we will be promoting our signature program New Sound. For every new student who enrolls we‚Äôll be donating $30 for organizations that support children and families in Ukraine. We‚Äôll also donate to other organizations that help other refugees around the world. 
We expecting to welcome over 500 students this round. 

2. If you‚Äôre a Ukrainian English teacher affected by the war, I‚Äôm inviting you to apply to teach in my program Beyond over the next few months. We‚Äôll be creating a new opportunity inside our Beyond program for members to sign up for free 1:1 lessons, and we‚Äôll be paying you for your work. 
We‚Äôll also be connecting teachers with members of our global community (outside of Beyond) looking for 1:1, and if you‚Äôve never taught online, we will help you figure out the tech and how to receive payment.

3. We‚Äôll be offering dozens of scholarships for New Sound, Sprint Master, and Beyond to Ukrainian refugees who need English now more than ever. 

If you need help yourself, or would like to help, go to http://hadarshemesh.com/ukraine

More ways to help:
Voices of Children, a charity that focuses on helping children recover from the psychological trauma of war. https://voices.org.ua/en/ 

GlobalGiving is providing supplies and support directly to Ukranian children with cancer who are being evacuated w/their mothers in a harrowing trip https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/war-in-ukraine-help-children-with-cancer/

Doctors Without Borders, whose base in Ukraine provides treatments for a range of regional diseases and medical problems. https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/news-stories/story/how-msf-responding-war-ukraine#p1

Project HOPE, a humanitarian organization that provides medical supplies and assistance to refugees both in Ukraine and after they‚Äôve fled to surrounding countries: https://secure.projecthope.org/

Save the Children, an international charity providing children with food, water and safety https://support.savethechildren.org/site/Donation2?df_id=5751&mfc_pref=T&5751.donation=form1

First of all, Happy International Women‚Äôs Day to all of the amazing women that I know in my life‚Ä¶ all of the strong, smart, successful women in every field. You are all powerful women who make a difference in the world every single day!! üíôüíõ
 
This year I would like to also make a special dedication to all of the Women of Ukraine‚Ä¶ the courageous women who have supported their husbands and said goodbye as the men stayed to fight for freedom. Also, to the women who have done whatever is necessary without hesitation to care for their children.
 
I especially want to call out the (s)hero of Ukraine, First Lady, Olena Zelenska, wife of President Volodymyr Zelensky,  the other half of the courageous couple that are putting their country and the people of Ukraine first. They are an excellent example for their country and for the world.
 
I pray for all of them daily and encourage all to follow her Instagram at olenazelenska_official. 
 
Also, for those wishing to contribute to the Ukrainian people, here are a few places to donate (click on the links below or tap on them in stories)‚Ä¶
 
üá∫üá¶ Save The Children (www.savethechildren.org/)
üá∫üá¶ Unicef (www.unicef.org/)
üá∫üá¶ Global Giving (/www.globalgiving.org/)
üá∫üá¶ Project Hope (www.projecthope.org/)

#internationalwomensday2022 #womensday #prayforukraine #standwithukraine #stopwar

The war is grinding on and the situation in Ukraine is getting worse. The people over there need our help. Here are a few ways you can continue to offer support.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
1. Call your representatives and urge them to continue supporting Ukraine.
2. Stay informed - and share information.
3. DONATE. Every dollar counts.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Here are some reputable places to donate:
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
UNICEF: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/unicef-children-crossfire-ukraine-crisis/39542
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Doctors Without Borders: https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/countries/ukraine
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
International Committee of the Red Cross: https://www.icrc.org/en/where-we-work/europe-central-asia/ukraine
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Voices of Children: https://voices.org.ua/en/
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Global Giving Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund: https://www.globalgiving.org/projects/ukraine-crisis-relief-fund/
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Help BIPOC, LGBTQ+ and disabled Ukrainian refugees: https://linktr.ee/ksvarnon
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Help animals: @uanimals.official
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
World Central Kitchen: https://wck.org/relief/activation-chefs-for-ukraine
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
There are many more - these are just a few.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Also, please keep in mind there are many other countries also struggling due to war. We can only have peace if we all take the time to help where we can.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Finally, a gentle reminder: there is a lot happening right now. It's too easy to get overwhelmed, feel guilty, or give into despair. Please take care of yourself. You need to take care of you so you can continue to do your good work in the world.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
xo
Theresa
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Our hearts have been absolutely breaking for the people of Ukraine, who have been thrust into the throes of this tragic war. It‚Äôs horrifying, seeing these images and hearing the interviews full of complete despair, of people fleeing and fighting for their lives and the lives of their families.

We stand with Ukraine, and ‚ú®TODAY‚ú® we are releasing our "I Don't Need a Ride, I Need More Ammunition" double Hazy IPA on draft and in cans, from which proceeds will go to aid Global Giving's Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund. @globalgiving üíôüíõ

My friend @fialkora who fled Kyiv and is now in Lviv asked me to share this. CW: violence, assault. Let us not move along and not forget. Demand justice for the people of Ukraine. 

If you have some resources, please consider sharing here: https://www.globalgiving.org/fundraisers/41535/

Somewhere in Italy, a young woman rushes on a date to a restaurant.

 In Poland, a little girl braids her favorite doll's hair and sings a song to her.

 In France, a man in an elegant suit chooses a necklace for his wife.

 In Australia, children play on the carpet and wait for their mother to bake a cake.

 In America, a woman cannot decide on a name for her newborn son.

 In a respectable age in Germany, a man walks in a park and listens to birds sing.

 At the same time ...Here. In Ukraine. War. Here. In Ukraine. Genocide.

Elderly people are bullied here. Men are being tortured. Shoot in the back of the head. Women are raped in front of children. Children are raped. They kill.

Here. In Ukraine. In 2022, people are buried in mass graves. Buried in the yards. Near the entrances. Or they just leave the bodies on the streets because there is no one to bury them. Here. In Ukraine. Here. In Ukraine. Destroy the population of cities. Clean up. Equalize settlements with land. They leave fires behind.

 At the same time

talk about us to the world. Russia is committing genocide against the Ukrainian people. pray for us and for peace in our lands.

#ukraine #helpukraine #ukrainewar
